derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French, feminine past participle of sortir 'go out'

entry.tran: 短程旅行(尤指去陌生地方)
entry.def: A sortie is a brief trip away from your home base, especially a trip to an unfamiliar place.

example.ex: From here we plan several sorties into the countryside on foot.
example.tran: 我们计划了几次从这里出发徒步去乡间的短途旅行。

entry.def: If a military force makes a sortie, it leaves its own position and goes briefly into enemy territory to make an attack.

example.ex: His men made a sortie to Guazatan and took a prisoner...
example.tran: 他的士兵袭击了瓜扎坦，擒获了一名俘虏。

example.ex: They flew 2,700 sorties in a day and didn't lose a single plane.
example.tran: 他们一天出动了 2,700 架次飞机，而且没有损失一架。

means.word_mean: 1. a military action in which besieged troops burst forth from their position
2. (military) an operational flight by a single aircraft (as in a military operation)

sentences.en: A series of sorties was carried out at night by specially equipped aircraft.
sentences.cn: 特别装备的战斗机在夜晚进行了几次突袭。

means.word_mean: 到陌生或环境不亲切的地方的短暂旅行

sentences.en: His first sortie into the world of film-making wasn’t very successful.
sentences.cn: 他初次涉足影坛时, 不太成功。
